answers.answer: Human trafficking is defined as the recruitment, transportation, transfer, harbouring, or receipt of persons by means of threats, use of force, or other forms of psychological pressure for the purpose of further exploitation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Human trafficking'.

answers.answer: You can find out what to do to reduce your vulnerability to human trafficking by exploring the information provided on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Human trafficking'.

answers.answer: The website indicates that you can find contacts to report in case of suspicion of human trafficking.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Human trafficking'.

answers.answer: One can learn more about child safety by accessing the information provided on the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Human trafficking'.

answers.answer: The "What to do in case of emergency or war" guide is a resource created by the Ukrainian authorities that provides detailed instructions on how to prepare for and act during emergencies or war.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Guide for what to do in case of emergency or war'.

answers.answer: The emergency or war guide provides detailed instructions on how to prepare for emergencies and how to act if they occur.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Guide for what to do in case of emergency or war'.

answers.answer: The provided content does not state when the "What to do in case of emergency or war" guide was created.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The website provides a list of shelters available in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/stay-safe and read the section under 'Map of shelters in Romania'.

answers.answer: A specific list of shelters in Bucharest is available on the website.
